result.execSummary:
The defendant Stanton L Klamik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
All costs to be paid FORTHWITH - in lieu of payment, defendant to serve an additional 10 days in the Waukesha County Jail - Consecutive - 10 Days Credit - Time Served - Paid in Full.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Court orders 110 days in the Waukesha County Jail.  110 days credit.  Time served.
